inn1.comm: that's left by the lefthander as an innocuous delivery sails with plenty of room across the batsman and down the channel
nudged a shorter one to the leg-side, but didn't quite get hold of it and it went straight to a fielder anyway
decent ball in the channel and the batsman shoulders arms
loose ball and a loose shot from Tharanga, who goes down on one knee and proposes to swoosh that one through cover, but he plays right over the top of that and misses completely
short, wide and gets the treatment, lashed through point for a confident four
Jayasuriya is off the mark straight away: he tickles a short ball into midwicket where it's winged back in quickly but not accurately and the batsmen scramble through without alarm in the end
left alone by the batsman as the ball whistles through over the stumps; decent delivery
the bowler falls away slightly in delivery and that one strays down the off-side; he was looking out-of-sorts with that one, and it's a no-ball to boot
ooh, another loose shot from Tharanga, reaching out to cover-drive one down the off-side channel, but he missed completely - again
left alone this time
a straight delivery right up there and that's defended down
another ball on the button and all the batsman can do is defend on the back foot
the batsman plays that fairly lateish, readjusting his thoughts as the ball pitches straight rears slightly and he fends that one down on the back foot
defended into covers, another decent delivery
that one strays down leg and the batsman chases it round; there was a noise but it came off the thigh pad, as it was Taylor fluffed any potential catch
punched nicely through point but Chigumbura chases that down well, just inside the boundary and the batsmen run three
right on the money and Tharanga can only defend that one down
that one strays down leg and the keeper misses that one again, too, the ball rolling behind him
tidy end to the over, there, with a decent delivery that's defended once more
gorgeous drive off the back foot through cover and that runs away off the back foot; a beautiful shot, just guided easily with sumptuous wrists
better from the bowler - straight and that's defended
the batsman didn't quite hold of that one, which he steers into the cover region and it's easily picked up
shorter ball, played off the back foot but it's swooped on by the man close in on the off side
tidier from the bowler, pitching on middle and off and that's defended
pushed right up there, the batsman tries to straight drive it and Mupariwa dives over the ball which crashes straight into the stumps at the non-striker's end, saving any runs

a good delivery but the batsman works that cleverly to leg, with a mere press, where they batsmen scramble a single as there is no fielder at square leg; indeed there are seven men on the off-side for Jayasuriya
just overstepped with a little extra effort there and the batsman doesn't quite manage to get hold of the ball, chopping it into the ground
didn't time that one properly, an inside edge flies through to the mid-wicket area
sends that one aerial, but just short of Chigumbura at point, and the few supporters in the ground cheer loudly at the temporary excitement
banged in by the bowler with a scrambled seam, but that's defended quite easily  in the end
ooh, that one pitched in line and there was an appeal. That pitched in line but height may have been a factor in the call being turned down, as was the possible inside edge
played a defensive one off the back foot to round off another tidy over
straight and that's defended again
another inside edge and that one flies behind square where it's winged back in without difficulty
crashing front-foot drive on the up through cover and that was four all the way
slight change of pace and that jumps off the bottom third of the bat but bounces easily shy of the mid-off
lifts a straight delivery into the mid-wicket region, but again the timing is not quite precise
defended off the back foot and a dot ball rounds off the over
on the money and that's defended
another tight delivery and again that's defended
made room to squeeze that one behind point, good wrist action
that one pitches on leg and the batsman tries to get over it, fails and the ball pops up into space on the leg-side
lovely cover-drive this time
dug out a full ball and turned it into a straight drive for a quick single
short and wide and that's hit out on the off, but Chigumbura does well to recover in the covers, after initially fluffing the ball
straight and true and that can only be defended
dug out into the covers
a big swoosh from the batsman and Taylor quickly takes the stumps, but the batsman is well in
makes that straight drive look really easy as he smacks it over long-off for a six, with a lot of bottom hand. Lovely
easy drive into the covers
that's better from Mupariwa; full and that's defended

absolutely brilliant fielding from Chigumbura after Jayasuriya went walk about at the non-striker's end. That wicket came from nowhere, but Jayasuriya was backing up too far and the Zimbabweans get their reward for some enthusiastic fielding. Jayasuriya walks off shaking his head
worked well off his hips just in front of square and that's some good running from the batsmen to make it two
ooh, the batsman whips his wrists at that one, trying to flash an off-drive back past the bowler, but a loose shot away from the body results in a complete miss
cracking shot, picked the gap but with a packed off-side field that won't go for four
compact stroke, nudged away behind square on the leg side for a comfortable two
driven into cover, straight to a fielder
helped off his legs to square first ball but he was very nearly out getting back for the two, but Ireland's throw was too wayward for Taylor to gather cleanly
defended this time
flashed hard at the short cover fielder who was straight on it
a good pick up and throw at mid-on by Utseya which takes the stumps, but the batsman was well in
more good fielding, this time on the leg-side where Masakadza runs and dives full stretch to cut off the ball. Good work
streaky shot, the batsman opens the face slightly and that runs down to third man
driven powerfully into the covers but straight to the fielder
attempted bouncer from Ireland and that surprised Jayawardene, good thinking from the bowler
defended into the covers

a short, wide ball brings another breakthrough for Zimbabwe as Jayawardene chases the delivery from Ireland and sends a thin edge through to Taylor. It would probably have been called a wide and Jayawardene can hardly believe what he's done but that's a huge wicket
he's off the mark straight away as he works the ball off his hips behind square for a couple
punched down the ground to deep mid off
defended down the pitch
pushed into the covers as Sangakkara just tries to find the pace of the pitch
guided to point again
scampered single into the covers and replays show it was a well-judged run
drifting down the leg side and well taken by Taylor who whips the bails off but it costs Zimbabwe a run
carved down to third man who keeps the batsmen to a single with a strong throw
on the mark first up as Tharanga defends
outside off stump and Tharanga has a flash but doesn't connect
he finds the middle of the bat with this one and sends it racing through the covers as Chigumbura drops fractionally short and wide
punched to mid on
short again but the batsman finds the fielder at point
the second boundary off the over goes racing through point and Tharanga is starting to look dangerous
pushed into the off side and Sangakkara takes the run that brings up 5000 in ODIs.
well fielded by the man at point but Rinke will have to right on target with his easy-paced bowling
on the front foot this time and driven to mid off
slightly shorter and Sangakkara goes onto the back foot and forces out into the covers
nicely worked off his legs through the on side and good running brings three to the total
driven into the covers and a sprawling save ends the over
clipped into the leg side but some sharp fielding prevents a run. The Zimbabweans have been excellent in the field so far.
punched through the covers but there's a sweeper out on the fence now
driven hard back to the bowler, but wasn't quite timed, and Chigumbura fields
not middled and bobbles out into the covers
straight bat from Tharanga as he watchfully defends down the ground. Chigumbura keeping a decent line.
what did I just say! This one is down the leg side and Sangakkara whips it behind square and it rolls across the ropes. That's a shame, it was a good over up till then.
worked down to third man with an angled bat
drives into the covers
slashes down to third man where Ireland does the fielding. Tharanga quick onto anything short and wide
now it's Sangakkara who keeps third man busy
clipped down the ground and Rinke falls over as he tries to collect
goes for the cut, flies down to third man, and this time wide of Ireland and Tharanga brings up his half century
drop and run from Sangakkara and a good understanding between the batsmen
driven to point, fumbled but no runs given away
picks out the fielder on the cover fence
Sangakkara happy to rotate the strike as he works down to third man
Tharanga frees his arms against some width from Chigumbura and it goes out to the cover sweeper
can't find the gap, but these two Sri Lankan batsmen are looking very busy
powerful square drive and third man can't get round in time as the ball races across the boundary. Rinke can't afford to be wide at his pace
extra bounce and Taylor can't collect as it strikes his arm and flies away
more good running and more good fielding in the covers
defended into the leg side and the tight field from Zimbabwe is doing its job so far
good length ball straight back to the bowler
another poor finish to an over as Rinke drifts onto the pads and Sangakkara flicks the ball past short fine-leg
worked down to mid on
another one off his legs, this time fielded by midwicket
takes the off-side route this time but still can't find the gap as it's fielded in the covers
short and wide and too wide for umpire Rauf who gets to stretch his arms out
goes powerfully over point and Tharanga carries Sri Lanka into three figures with another impressive display
this one is sweetly hit through the covers but the man on the fence stops the boundary. Tharanga having no problems with the slightly two-paced nature of the surface
finds the fielder at cover this time
pushed into the leg side
short, but Sangakkara misses out as he finds midwicket with his pull shot
lashes this one into the covers but a tumbling save stops any runs
finds the fielder at cover again
I could just say 'see below', but won't. Sangakkara drives into the tight off side field
Back to the bowler and an excellent start from Chibhabha
good flight there from Utseya and it sails in on the button, where it's defended
cover-driven this time
more flight and loop but the batsman waited for that one, cover-driving it easily but without much pace
looked to work that into midwicket
a wild flash at that one
defended this time
straight-driven and the bowler leapt back on that one to cut off any chance of a run
that drops just a touch wide and that's pushed out behind point
drops on a good length and that's worked into mid-wicket
pushed out to cover
well pitched up and smothered this time
looped in and defended again
hit to cover
on the button and the batsman tries to tickle it square
well picked up at mid-wicket by the fielder scurrying to his left
easy cover-drive, hit without much power
hit out to long-on
defended this time to complete another good over
driven to cover
drops that one short and Tharanga thwacks it over through midwicket
the batsman comes forward to defend this time
the batsman dances down to that, and eases it into midwicket, where it's cannoened back in
full toss and that's swept out to the sweeper
defended this time
wideish and the batsman tries to drive it
comes right forward and defends at the last minute
the ball didn't quite come onto the bat and an attempted pull through midwicket isn't executed cleanly
defended this time
waited for that one and it's worked off the back foot to extra cover
tried to paddle that behind square but a leading edge pops up gently
easily driven out to Matsikenyeri at long-off
Kamungozi dives on to that one at short mid-wicket
defended
on-driven but the bowler picks it up
picked up again by the bowler
paddled round behind square
dropped that one wide and the batsman reaches out to cover drive it
paddled that one round behind square
pushed up and defended
driven to mid-on
hit out to cover
defended
good control from the bowler and that's defended again
the batsman waited for it this time, playing with the drift and they scurry through despite a shy from the fielder
defended
waited for that and it's cut firmly to point
defended this time
waited for that and played a defensive off the back foot
wide and that's worked right out to the boundary where it's zoomed back in
lofted drive falls appreciably short of the fielder at wide long-off
comes down the track, thinking of driving, but defends
a slight misfield by Chigumbura allows the single
a lovely pick-up off the toes rolls through to deep mid-wicket
overstepped, there
a single down to long-on
thought of a quick single but it was never on as the fielder rushed in from short midwicket
fails to get hold of a sweep and the ball flies between the batsman's legs
that's well picked up again in the field at short mid-wicket
gets over the ball and Kamungozi does well in the field this time
drops that one short and the ball is worked down to Ireland in the deep
uses his feet to fly the ball over to deep midwicket
down the track, inside out over cover, a cracking shot
short and hammered through the covers
danced down the pitch, thumped to long on and well fielded
dabbed into the covers
another no ball from the offspinner, spinners should never overstep
charges the bowler and crunches the ball through cover with a glorious drive
looked for a single into the covers but sent back
goes for the sweep and gets a top edge over the keeper, short fine-leg fields
over cover again and splits the gap perfectly between long off and deep over, great shot
thumping straight hit and the boundaries and starting to flow now
guided to short third-man
short and pulled down to long on
thick outside half of the bat and short fine-leg fields
well time out towards deep cover and well fielded on the ropes
defended on the front foot
tickled towards square leg
powerful strike through the covers but Masakadza is brilliant out on the boundary
quicker ball and not timed into the leg side
goes for the sweep, bottom edge into his toe and goes past the keeper. A shout from the bowler but the umpire spotted the edge
swung through square leg
worked to short fine leg, Tharanga now just a boundary away from a century
pushed into the covers
cut out to the man on the cover fence
beautiful footwork from Sangakkara who brings up his fifty with a crunching clip over midwicket
sweep beats the keeper
swept out to deep square-leg

and there's Tharanga's century, uses his feet and slots the ball through the covers and some outstanding running brings three. But the umpire is going to the TV replay as Sangakkara had to dive in, so Tharanga will have to wait a moment. The throw was wide and it took Taylor too long to whip the bails off and Sangakkara is safe. It's Tharanga's second ton in two matches.
crunching sweep out to the man on the square-leg fence
slapped into the covers
an attempted pull flies down to long off as the slow pitch defeats the batsman
out into the covers
ball stays low and bottom edge dribbles behind the keeper
powerful drive through the covers and the batsmen run well between the wickets
again through the covers and well timed, but the fielder slides on the cover fence to stop the boundary. More sharp work from the Zimbabweans
attempted dab to third man but misses
launched down the ground and goes straight through Ireland at long on
into the covers
down to long on
pulled out to the midwicket boundary
a well-timed sweep but the man from midwicket makes it this time
the Sri Lankan charge is well and truly on now as Sanagkkara goes over midwicket
driven out to deep cover
past the bowler down to long on
tries to power that one through the off side but doesn't time it and it bobbles down the pitch
the slowness of the track again makes a pull go to the off side rather than the leg
more running for the batsmen, down to long off
In the air, but this time a lack of timing saves the batsman as it falls short of the fielder at long off
worked down the ground to keep the strike
his first ball is swept to the fine-leg fence
worked away into the off side

goes for a big swing through the leg side, but he was getting tired and missed the ball by a fair distance as it crashes into the stumps. The end of another fine innings from the left-hander who has built a platform from which the rest of the Sri Lankan batsmen can really have a dip in the closing overs.&
awful delivery, no shot from Atapattu
clipped into the leg side to open his account
in the block hole, dug out down to long on
driven carefully to cover
hammered out to deep over
dropped out towards point
pushed into the offside

tries to clear long off but doesn't get hold of the lofted drive and is comfortably held by Matsikenyeri. An impressive innings from Sangakkara but now Sri Lanka have two new batsmen in the middle so maybe there's a chance for the Zimbabweans to keep the total down
off the back foot out to cover
cut away and the fielder on the boundary keeps it to one
the batsman dances forward and hits a straight ball round to midwicket
waited for that and played with good soft hands into the midwicket area where the batsmen run two; intelligent cricket
defended this time
helped to midwicket for an easy single
a touch more flight this time and the batsman came forward to defend
wide and the batsman helps that one out to point
dropped that one short outside the off stick and that's pummelled to the midwciket boundary
the batsmen decide against an extra run as that one goes to deep long-off
launches big into that one, but mistimes it and sends the ball to midwicket
stops on a drive and the ball rolls to mid-off
that one strayed down off and the batsman just opened his hands easily to steer that one to third man
struck to mid-off, almost dug out; there was a quick thought of a second but the batsmen soon changed their minds

a bit of a soft dismissal. The batsman tried to paddle that, got a bit of a top edge and that's straight down's Kamungozi's throat at square leg, and the fielder makes no mistake. That's another blip in Sri Lanka's progress
ooh, close call. The batsman offered no shot to a topspinner, an odd ball to leave alone as it pitched on the stumps
got over the ball and eased that to midwicket
over the ball again and that's defended this time
a quick single this time
another good ball to finish Utseya's spell
shorter one, but the batsman has time to duck under it
fuller this time but the batsman makes room to cover drive and the fielder has a shy at the non-striker's end, though missed, allowing an overthrow
trademark square drive crashed to the boundary, trademark Atapattu, that
jogged single
guided out to mid-off
a huge outside edge flies without danger down to Mupariwa at third man
smothered that one
drops short and wide; that's well played after the batsman waited a long time to play that one, climbing into a lovely cut through the covers
better ball, fuller, and the batsman gets over that one to defend
a nudge into the off-side this time
guided to third man
the ball hardly gets up as it goes wide and that's slashed to the off-side to bring up the 250
a ferocious slash results in a thick inside edge which crashes past the stumps and behind square
crashed out to cover this time
driven out to mid-off
walked out to meet that one which pitches on the off and that's worked over to the leg side
full toss but that's driven out to cover
driven out to midwicket
scrambled single, well taken, after the batsman nudges that one to the off-side
another quick single, again into the off-side
yet another single, driven to mid-off this time
that was a huge shout and a deserved wicket; the ball was nicely flighted and that pitched in line, turned a touch and that's the first wicket of the day for Kamungozi, his third in all.
that's nudged to backward point and the batsmen run through
moved his feet to that one and drives it through cover
right up in the blockhole, looking to hit leg stump and the batsman squeezes that one out to long-off
drops that short and it's heaved away through the legside for Murali's first boundary which is greeted by huge cheers from the small crowd
short again and that's clubbed away again on the legside off the bottom of the bat
fresh air shot from a good length ball in the corridor
improvised clip away over square but that's collected by the sweeper
comes forward to meet that full toss and that's worked away to square
worked out to cover with a nice up-and-over shot
that's clubbed off the bottom of the bat straight down long-off's throat and Muralitharan's cameo (10 from six balls) comes to an end
helped out to cover
good placement behind point and that's well run, too
swatted to square this time
cheeky little dink upwards which lands way short of square leg
well bowled, just outside off, with a hint of inswing, and there's a swoosh at that one
swung away over extra cover for two
helped into midwicket
square-driven on one knee
lashed to mid-on
Atapattu tries a scoop and misses, while Taylor misses the stumps - the batsman would have been well out and they get a single from the final ball

inn2.comm: opening delivery from Malinga flies through from a good length
slightly shorter the batsman watches it sail through to Sangakkara
defended into the off side
pushes away from his body, low edge to second slip who has to dive in front of first but can't quite get his hand under the ball and it flies away to the boundary. Would have been a stunning catch.
plenty of again, again left to the keeper
wayward start from Perera as he fires this wide of the stumps

pushed into the covers, great stop from Dilshan who throws at the stumps and Rinke would have been short with a direct hit. In fact, if Perera had been there to collect the throw he might still have been short but the bowler was standing in mid-pitch
defended into the off side
worked off his hips behind square
Rinke pulls the bat inside the line of the ball
that was very much on the cards. Perera pitches up and finds a hint of inswing, a loose drive from Rinke takes the inside edge and crashes into the stumps.
pitched up, hint of swing, left alone and the end of an impressive first over from Perera

and another one goes. Huge waft away from his body against a delivery that bounces and Mufambisi sends a high edge flying towards Jayawardene at second slip, who this time makes no mistake and pouches it with two hands above his head. Sadly, it's a familiar tale for Zimbabwe but this is impressive bowling from Malinga
ball thuds into the pads and goes down the pitch
left alone as Malinga continues work up decent pace
pitched up and the ball swings away, Masakadza prods at it but doesn't get anywhere near
short and watched through to the keeper
just a little too wide this time and umpire Rauf gives the required signal
defended out to point to end a fine, quick over from Malinga and the batsmen don't look very comfortable
defended on the front foot, covers the swing well
back of a length and forced down to third man with the batsman using the pace on the ball
full and more swing from Perera, a thick outside edge flies along the ground to third man
driven down the ground but not timed and fielded by mid off
very wide and that was an easy call for the umpire
big shout as the ball swings back into the pads but the ball was just drifting down the leg side
thick inside edge into the pads as Perera continues to trouble the batsmen with his late swing
swings away, left alone
batsman pushes away from his body and the ball lands short of Sangakkara
cracking forcing shot off the back foot and it flies square down to third man who completes a sharp piece of fielding
defended back to the bowler
thuds into the thigh pad and bobbles into the leg side
back of a length and forced down to mid off
but this one is again too wide from Perera, he has a habit if losing his line
deflected down to third man off the outer half of the bat
full ball and worked into the gap at midwicket
pitched up and struck straight back to the bowler
comes forward to this one with bat and pad close together, cover does the fielding
tries to drive, but doesn't get any timing into the shot and it just lobs down the pitch towards mid off
aimed through extra cover but the ball flies down to third man off an outside edge because of Perera's pace
carved away over backward point and this one races into the fence for a welcome boundary
this is more on target and Masakadza just defends it down to mid on
that was close, Masakadza goes for a drive but the ball nips back and squeezes between bat and pad, just missing the off stump by millimetres
worked into the leg side with some nice wrist work

outstanding bowling from Malinga, the pace was too much for Chibhabha as he is caught on the crease and sends a thick edge towards third slip where Dilshan holds a sharp chance down by his ankles. Zimbabwe's top order again being blown away.
Taylor is well behind his first ball and defends it into the covers
wide and left alone
on the off stump, defended out to point
on a good length, met with the full face of the bat
shoulders arms as the ball moves across his body
pushed out to mid off
tries an expansive drive but loses his shape on the shot and gets no timing, flies out to cover who fields on the bounce
played from the crease, pushed into the covers as Taylor opens his account
back of a length, punched to Murali at mid off
full ball, hint of inswing and driven back to the bowler
on the off stump, again short of a good length, driven off the back foot to point
flies through and Masakadza prods at it
back to the bowler
short and on target, Taylor has to sway out of the way limbo style as it goes through to Sangakkara
nicely clipped off his pads but not quite with enough force to reach the ropes as Malinga runs round from fine leg
pitched up and Masakadza goes over mid off with power and timing - excellent shot
another boundary, this one not as convincing as it flies wide of slip and down to third man
swings into the pads and goes into the on side
inside edge onto his boot, out towards the slips
steered that one to mid-off
pushed right up there and that's defended solidly
short and that's struck out hard to point where it's picked up tidily
turned round off his pads behind square
good delivery in the channel, drawing him into the drive, but he pulled out and shouldered arms
overstepped on that one and the batsman helps it into cover
fired right up there
that one was nearly called wide as it was pushed across the batsman who left it well alone
the batsman shouldered arms again, but that ball was closer to the stumps, only still too wide to be of interest
an inside edge goes behind square for a single
good ball, on a good length and decent seam, rising up at the batsman who defended it down off the back foot
another good delivery and the batsman chops down on it at the last minute off the back foot
a huge top edge and the batsman swivels round with the momentum as the ball bounces just once before the rope at third man
overstepped again
slower ball and the batsman stands tall and plays with soft hands, steering that into the covers
a big outside edge on that and the ball rolls down to third man
in the blockhole and that's defended
drives into the covers and the batsmen scramble a single
squared up and an outside edge beats the diving Dilshan at gully but he gets a hand on it and the batsmen have to settle for one
ooh, banged in and the batsman takes his eyes off it as he attempts a hook that, in the end, is nowhere near the ball
defended on the back foot
just strayed on to a leg-side line and the ball is scrambled out square
rises on to his back foot to play a defensive with soft hands
flashed hard and completely missed
defended that one
turned off his hips through to square where Malinga rushes round the boundary and picks that up well
got nicely behind the ball, which crashed in at the off stump, to defend off the back foot
defended again off the back foot
too wide for Sangakkara to get a hand on it and that shuffles away to the boundary
a cover-drive this time, which is picked up cleanly
the batsmen think about a single as Taylor hits that into the covers, but he sends Masakadza back, and that's a good decision
the batsman was in trouble there, forced to defend on the back foot, as that ball was sharp, but the bowler had also massively overstepped
defended into the covers
wide down the off side
in the gap and that was in the air for a second but it's well timed and punsshed off the back foot through the covers
a good ball and that's defended on the back foot
defended again
played off the back foot again
driven off the back foot through cover, a lovely shot and the momentum is beginning to build for Zimbabwe
a big edge from a wild slash and that runs away through third man
banged in hard and that's defended off the back foot
defended off the back foot
mistimed cut to point
tucked up Masakadza this time
driven to cover this time where it's picked up cleanly
short ball helped into midwicket
driven through cover and that rolls smoothly to the boundary
tickled into midwicket
helped to backward of square
a strong cover drive but one which wasn't properly timed and that's picked up inside the boundary
an under-edge just eludes Sangakkara and runs to the boundary
pushed right up there and that's defended
overstepped, and that's hit out to point
pushed right up there and that's defended
defended
that's defended forward
whipped through midwicket and they get back for three after a misfield
cleaned up with a pearler that came back in and went right through the gate, taking middle and off stumps. Another good fight from Taylor, with a very promising innings, comes to an end
Fernando lets out a groan as that sails down the off-side channel and through to the keeper
driven to cover
squared up by that one which was just leaving him and he got an edge on it which was cleanly taken with two hands by Sangakkara, away to his right. And that's a slow walk off for the batsman
moved away off the seam

launched into that one with positive intent but that's another wicket, with a run-out. Kamikaze call for a second run there and the batsman had no chance of getting back in as the bowler picked up the relay and threw it to Sangakkara who took the stumps cleanly
oh dear, that was very wide
opened the face and that was just wide of the keeper
lovely square drive for Utseya and that runs away nicely
defended out into the off side
driven to mid off but with no timing
left well alone outside off stump
pushed into the covers
in the block-hole, dug out back to the bowler
left alone again, ends an over where Fernando managed not to overstep and in fact it's a maiden
offspinner to offspinner and Utseya clips it into the leg side
clips the pads, onto the on side
worked through the covers
struck to the square-leg fielder
tries to work into the leg side with the spin but just takes the pad
finally the hundred comes up with a well placed drive down to long off
Fernando is back to his overstepping routine and a thick edge flies down to third man and just evades a valiant dive from the fielder on the ropes
Fernando comes back well with a short ball, Utseya can't decide how to play it and takes a blow flush on the helmet, just where his badge would be if he had one.
to his credit Utseya gets well behind this good length ball and defends it out to cover, he's a plucky cricketer
right behind this one and driven firmly to mid on
forced off the back foot into the covers, nearly mix-up but Matsikenyeri gets back at the bowler's end
this one bounces and takes the glove onto the leg side, Utseya having a tough time in the middle

you could see that wicket coming a mile off and it's Matsikenyeri who falls to the short ball as he can't get out of the way, the ball takes the glove and flies behind the wicket. Sangakkara tries to jump for it but Jayasuriya runs round and grabs a comfortable chance as the end gets closer for Zimbabwe
tries to sweep but misses and a sharp take from Sangakkara
defended out onto the leg side
loud shout for lbw but the ball hit just outside the line of off stump and also might have spun past leg
another attempted sweep thuds into the pads
worked into the midwicket area
a similar shot, but just takes the pad
The short-pitched attack continues as Mupariwa takes one in the body
outside off stump and left to the keeper
attempted yorker but the batsman gets down on it and forces the ball back to the bowler
outside edge down to third man where Maharoof cleans up
another very full ball which is squeezed out onto the off side
guided out to point and the end of another tight over from Fernando
on the front foot defended
a chance flies straight through Dilshan at silly point, goes down as a drop
clipped to square leg
played back to Murali
tries to sweep but doesn't connect
good length, solid defence from Mupariwa
similar ball, similar shot but Malinga is just warming up
slightly on leg stump and clipped down to fine leg
inswinger, gets down on it and knocks it towards the bowler
short ball but this time Utseya gets out of the way
this bouncer is off target from Malinga as it goes high down the leg side
too quick for Utseya as it crashes into his pad and lobs into the leg side
bat and pad close together
guess what? yep, same again from Mupariwa. Don't think we are in for a thriller here, but what do I know
didn't have a clue which way that was going and wafts at the ball
brilliant doosra from Murali which on the replays looks plumb lbw but Aleem Dar thought otherwise and the batsmen survives
manages to defend this one
on the front foot again to end another tight over
worked out to deep square-leg
solid defence from Mupariwa but you sense this innings could finish very quickly
bowler appeals for lbw but it wouldn't have hit another set
way down the leg side, Malinga not quite finding his range in this spell
firm drive to mid on
and a similar drive to mid off. Mupariwa can defend a bit but doesn't seem to have many shots
digs out a yorker which stops almost dead in the crease
Utseya comes forward and defends as Murali goes round the wicket
clipped into the leg side but straight to the fielder at midwicket
finds the gap this time to rotate the strike
takes the pad
this one finds the middle of the bat and goes out on the off side
a small piece of action as Mupariwa finds the gap at cover and they scamper a couple
big appeal for lbw, bowling wide of the crease and turning it considerably
wide and that was fished at
wide down the leg-side and it's called so
defended this time
pitches outside off and turns in, forcing the defensive
hit out to square and that's whistled back in
again that's on the button and that's defended on the front foot, the batsman quietened here
bowled wider of the crease and the batsman thought it was spinning back in, so left it; in fact it went the other way
the batsman comes forward and snuffs out any danger
pitches just in front of off and that's defended strongly
whipped in again and that's defended off the back foot
put on the button and that's defended once more - there's a bit of a theme of defence, here
and, what do you know, there goes another one
another defence
any guesses? Yes, a defensive shot
more defence, this time forced by Murali
defended once again
a run! Two, even! That's worked into the covers and the batsmen jog through
ah, back to defence again - this is great containing bowling by Sri Lanka
comes around the wicket to change the angle but the batsman is able to work that off his hips and away for a single
a looser one and the batsman tries to sweep, but just misses out
defended
defended again
more defence
a huge screech of an appeal but that's turned down and that's a pretty good decision - it looked like it would be missing leg
defended this time
more screeching but once again the umpire is unmoved - this was less of a convincing shout
comes out to drive through cover
helped into midwicket
defended this time
an impatient slash at that ball, and the batsman misses it; the keeper collects

edged and gone! Muralitharan gets a wicket with a doosra, with a simple feather straight to the welcoming hands of first slip. "Give Murali a stationary target long enough..." deadpans Jeff Dujon, and he couldn't be more right.
the batsman didn't look very convincing there, and that's being generous as he walks forward to defend
half-calls of "Catch it" (so, a bit like"Cat...") but that falls just shy of the man in short
down the ground for a single
defended
a solid defence this time
more defence
another predictable dot to end the over
where did that shot come from?! Murali tossed that one up and the batsman's eyes light up and his feet get dancing as he comes down to launch that up and over long-on. More of the same, please
defended this time
defended once more
more defence, it's very quiet around here now
and that's squeezed out to cover this time
slung in and that's very wide
down the corridor and that's beaten the outside edge
wide again, oh dear
played and missed
another play-and-miss but it's still a bit too wide from the bowler
a half-cry, trying to slide that one through the gate
another doosra and that's comprehensively beaten the batsman who was looking for the off-break, but it went the other way, just rubbing the outside edge and Sangakkara does the rest
that pops up a little bit
there was some bat on that one, but that just evades the man in short on the off-side
how did that miss? It just went through straight
and that's defended to end the over
short, on the off stump and zips past the edge
strikes the pads but going well down the leg side
very wide outside off stump
gets bat onto this one and they scamper a single
outside off stump and left to the keeper
inswinger and defended from the crease
attempted yorker, hits the boot but drifting down the leg side
this one slips out and goes on the full toss past the stumps
gets this yorker on target but it is well dug out
gives himself room and crunches this towards mid off who runs round and keeps it to a single
all defence from Kamungozi who is still looking for his first international run
draws the bat inside the line and the ball goes over the stumps
goes for a drive, misses, and the rather turgid end to this match continues
tries to give himself room again, doesn't time the ball and goes to mid off
hold onto your hats folks, it's a boundary! A thick edge flies over the slips and down to third man

finally Malinga gets one straight and Mupariwa misses a wild heave to bring this match to an end. The result has been known for much of Zimbabwe's innings but the Sri Lankan bowlers will be pleased with their run out, although there were a few too many extras once again
